title: Cognizant Q4 results: revenue dips 1.7%, profit rises to $558 million
description: For the full year 2023, the global IT major Cognizant posted a 0.4% YoY decline in revenue to $19.4 billion. In constant currency terms, it was 0.3% lower.
content: US-based Cognizant Technology Solutions posted a 7% increase in net profit year-on-year (YoY) for the fourth quarter ending December at $558 million. This was backed by healthy deal wins, acquisitions and steady margins during the period.The profit stood at $521 million a year-ago quarter ending December 2022.Revenue declined 1.7% YoY to $4.76 billion for the fourth quarter ending December, a likely eight-quarter low, owing to continued weakness in demand and limited tech spending by clients. The revenue growth was majorly supported by the inorganic growth made during the quarter including the advisory firm Thirderaâ€™s acquisition announced in December.Sequentially, the revenue fell by 2.9% while in constant currency terms, revenue declined by 2.4% the Nasdaq-listed information technology (IT) and professional services firm.Its two large verticals financial services and health sciences continued to remain weak with growth dipping by 5.8% and 2.1%, respectively. Growth came from two other verticals - products & resources and communications, media and technology - witnessing 1.3% and 2.6% rise in revenues for Q4FY23. Geographically, North America (-1.6%), UK (-1.1%) and Rest of the World (-9.9%) declined, with 3.8% uptick in business from Continental Europe.
